description:
The year is 2052 — an era of unprecedented peace and prosperity prevails across the globe. The reason for this: mankind has been freed from sickness and pain. Nobel Prize winning neuroscientist Dr. Skinner has developed a miracle cure-all drug with no apparent drawbacks called Hapuna. Hapuna soon becomes ubiquitous… and essential. However, soon after Hapuna is officially introduced, Dr. Skinner vanishes.

Three years later, the world has moved on. But Dr. Skinner has returned — this time, as a harbinger of doom. Skinner announces that Hapuna has a short half-life. Everyone who has taken it will die approximately three years later. Death is coming for this sinful world — and coming soon.

As a response to this threat, a special task force of 5 agents is gathered from across the world to save humanity from Skinner’s plan. This group is called “Lazarus.” Can they find Skinner and develop a vaccine before time runs out?

(Source: Adult Swim)

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Medicine
tags.description: Centered around the activities of people working in the field of medicine.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Parkour
tags.description: Centers around the sport of parkour.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Drugs
tags.description: Prominently features the usage of drugs such as opioids, stimulants, hallucinogens etc.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Cyberpunk
tags.description: Set in a future of advanced technological and scientific achievements that have resulted in social disorder.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: Death Game
tags.description: Features characters participating in a game, where failure results in death.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Environmental
tags.description: Concern with the state of the natural world and how humans interact with it.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Espionage
tags.description: Prominently features characters infiltrating an organization in order to steal sensitive information.

tags.name: Prison
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a prison.

tags.name: Cult
tags.description: Features a social group with unorthodox religious, spiritual, or philosophical beliefs and practices.

tags.name: Circus
tags.description: Prominently features a circus.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

alternative: Mad Screamer (マッド・スクリーマー)

node.description:
Most known for directing critically and commercially successful series, [Cowboy Bebop](https://anilist.co/anime/1/) and [Samurai Champloo](https://anilist.co/anime/205/).

He is noted for blending together multiple genres in his anime. For example, in Cowboy Bebop, classic cowboy western mixes with '60s/'70s New York City film noir, jazz/blues music, Hong Kong action movies, and to top it off the series is set in space. In his later work, Samurai Champloo, he unites the cultures of Okinawa, hip hop, modern-day Japan, and chanbara.

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/chadstahelski) 

American film director and stuntman. He is best known for directing the 2014 film *John Wick* and its three sequels. He worked as a stunt double for his future *John Wick* star [Keanu Reeves](https://anilist.co/staff/173696) in *The Matrix* franchise, and later served as a stunt co-ordinator for the films. Founder and Co-Director of 87Eleven Action Design.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/141121934) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/akemi_h_0808/) | [Blog](http://replica08.web.fc2.com/index.html)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/brunetstanislas)

[Official Site](https://bonobomusic.com/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/bonoboofficial/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/si_bonobo/) | [Twitter](https://x.com/si_bonobo) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/BonoboVids) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0cmWgDlu9CwTgxPhf403hb)

 English musician, producer, and DJ based in Los Angeles.

[Official Site](https://floatingpoints.co.uk/) | [Twitter](https://x.com/floatingpoints) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/floatingpoints) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@FloatingPointsMusic) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/2AR42Ur9PcchQDtEdwkv4L)

English electronic music producer, DJ, and musician. He is the founder of Pluto Records, co-founder of Eglo Records, and leader of a 16-piece group called Floating Points Ensemble.

[Official Site](https://www.kamasiwashington.com/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kamasiw/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kamasiwashington) | [Twitter](https://x.com/kamasiw) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@KamasiWashington) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/6HQYnRM4OzToCYPpVBInuU)

Celebrated, award-winning Los Angeles saxophonist and composer whose albums have spearheaded a renaissance in jazz. He is a founding member of the jazz collective West Coast Get Down. 

He has achieved widespread acclaim and recognition for his work on Kendrick Lamar's modern masterpiece "To Pimp A Butterfly" as well as his own solo work, with seminal albums which had a major impact on the jazz-fusion scene like his 2015 masterpiece "The Epic". He is also a founding member of the neo-soul supergroup "Dinner Party" in collaboration with pianist Robert Glasper, multi-instrumentalist Terrace Martin, & soul hip-hop producer 9th Wonder.

Recently, his works of note have included 2024's "Fearless Movement" with a wide array of collaborators including but not limited to founding father of funk George Clinton, hip-hop legend and flautist André 3000, and well-renowned bassist [Thundercat](https://anilist.co/staff/221889/Thundercat). He has also played a major role in creating the soundtrack to veteran director [Shinichirou Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/97009/Shinichirou-Watanabe)'s 2025 anime series "[Lazarus](https://anilist.co/anime/167336/LAZARUS)".
Originating from Studio 4°C. Currently affiliated with [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/MAPPA).
Representative Director of Animo Caramel
Affiliated with [Mappa](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).
Supervising Sound Editor at Formosa Group.

Most known for directing critically and commercially successful series, [Cowboy Bebop](https://anilist.co/anime/1/) and [Samurai Champloo](https://anilist.co/anime/205/).

He is noted for blending together multiple genres in his anime. For example, in Cowboy Bebop, classic cowboy western mixes with '60s/'70s New York City film noir, jazz/blues music, Hong Kong action movies, and to top it off the series is set in space. In his later work, Samurai Champloo, he unites the cultures of Okinawa, hip hop, modern-day Japan, and chanbara.

In 2001, he won the 39th Chiba Tetsuya Grand Prize in the general category of the 39th Chiba Tetsuya Award for "Chabudai".
In the same year, "Chabudai Kenta" was serialized. His masterpiece "Dai Tokyo Toy Box" won second place at the Manga Awards 2012, was recommended by the jury of the Japan Media Arts Award 2013, and was also made into a TV drama in 2014. In addition, "Tom Sawyer in the South," in which a child from the city survives on a remote island in Okinawa with an iPhone in one hand, "Steves," which depicts the division of Silicon Valley in the 1970s, centering on Steve Jobs and Steve Wozniak, and "Kyokuman," a documentary manga about the Antarctic Research Expedition.

In 2010, he became the first Japan manga artist to self-publish Aozora Finder Rock on the Amazon Kindle Store. In 2012, a project to raise funds for the writing of the web manga "STEVES" on a crowdfunding site reached the target amount in the fastest time in history at the time, and attracted attention for its attempt to combine manga with services and platforms on the web.
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐藤大)

[Official Site](https://www.kamasiwashington.com/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kamasiw/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kamasiwashington) | [Twitter](https://x.com/kamasiw) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@KamasiWashington) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/6HQYnRM4OzToCYPpVBInuU)

Celebrated, award-winning Los Angeles saxophonist and composer whose albums have spearheaded a renaissance in jazz. He is a founding member of the jazz collective West Coast Get Down. 

He has achieved widespread acclaim and recognition for his work on Kendrick Lamar's modern masterpiece "To Pimp A Butterfly" as well as his own solo work, with seminal albums which had a major impact on the jazz-fusion scene like his 2015 masterpiece "The Epic". He is also a founding member of the neo-soul supergroup "Dinner Party" in collaboration with pianist Robert Glasper, multi-instrumentalist Terrace Martin, & soul hip-hop producer 9th Wonder.

Recently, his works of note have included 2024's "Fearless Movement" with a wide array of collaborators including but not limited to founding father of funk George Clinton, hip-hop legend and flautist André 3000, and well-renowned bassist [Thundercat](https://anilist.co/staff/221889/Thundercat). He has also played a major role in creating the soundtrack to veteran director [Shinichirou Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/97009/Shinichirou-Watanabe)'s 2025 anime series "[Lazarus](https://anilist.co/anime/167336/LAZARUS)".

[Official Site](https://www.thebooradleys.com/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/booradleysofficial/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/booradleysofficial)

English alternative rock band who were associated with the shoegazing and Britpop movements in the 1990s. They originally formed in Wallasey, England, in 1988. The band split up in 1999 and reunited in 2021 without guitarist Martin Carr.

[Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/clarknova.bsky.social)

SVP Anime & Action Series/Longform for Warner Discovery.
VP and Creative Director for on-air at Adult Swim.
Co-Creator and Senior Writer/Producer for Toonami.
Founder of Williams Street Records.

While growing up in Korea Joseph Chou became exposed to Japanese anime which inspired him to go into the entertainment industry. He came to work for Warner Home Entertainment group as the project The Animatrix began picking up momentum. After the surprise success of The Animatrix, Chou was placed head of a division within Warner to oversee new animation projects. He helped lead the way for other projects such as Batman Gotham Knight to be produced after he left Warner. He's worked with some noted industry giants such as Shinji Aramaki and John Woo, as well as people in the U.S. such as ADV founder John Ledford.

He is the founder and CEO of [Sola Digital Arts](https://anilist.co/studio/6195/), an anime production company.
Masahiro Tamai is a CG artist.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mocchi_0422)

Affiliated with [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/MAPPA).

**Not to be confused with [the animator of the same name.](https://anilist.co/staff/196999)*
Masashi Yabuhara is a recording and mixing engineer.

[Instagram 1](https://www.instagram.com/podsiadlomichal/) | [Instagram 2](https://www.instagram.com/tataaktor/)

Voice actor and dubbing director at TransPerfect Media Poland and VSI Warsaw.
